Uses of Class
com.stormpath.sdk.client.ClientApplicationBuilder

  • Packages that use ClientApplicationBuilder 
    Package Description
    com.stormpath.sdk.client  

    • Uses of ClientApplicationBuilder in com.stormpath.sdk.client

      Methods in com.stormpath.sdk.client that return ClientApplicationBuilder 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ClientApplicationBuilder ClientApplicationBuilder.setApiKeyFileLocation(String location)
      Deprecated. 
      Sets the location of the .properties file to load containing the API Key (Id and secret) used by the Client to communicate with the Stormpath REST API.
      ClientApplicationBuilder ClientApplicationBuilder.setApiKeyIdPropertyName(String apiKeyIdPropertyName)
      Deprecated. 
      Sets the name used to query for the API Key ID from a Properties instance.
      ClientApplicationBuilder ClientApplicationBuilder.setApiKeyInputStream(InputStream is)
      Deprecated. 
      Creates an API Key Properties instance based on the specified InputStream instead of loading a .properties file via apiKeyFileLocation configuration.
      ClientApplicationBuilder ClientApplicationBuilder.setApiKeyProperties(Properties properties)
      Deprecated. 
      Allows usage of a Properties instance instead of loading a .properties file via apiKeyFileLocation configuration.
      ClientApplicationBuilder ClientApplicationBuilder.setApiKeyReader(Reader reader)
      Deprecated. 
      Creates an API Key Properties instance based on the specified Reader instead of loading a .properties file via apiKeyFileLocation configuration.
      ClientApplicationBuilder ClientApplicationBuilder.setApiKeySecretPropertyName(String apiKeySecretPropertyName)
      Deprecated. 
      Sets the name used to query for the API Key Secret from a Properties instance.
      ClientApplicationBuilder ClientApplicationBuilder.setApplicationHref(String applicationHref)
      Deprecated. 
      Sets the fully qualified Stormpath Application HREF (a URL) to use to acquire the Application instance when build() is called.
